Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so the diff adjustment does what it does and adjusts the diff based on the blocks found

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but it takes longer than the usual 100 blocks because the PoW diff adjusts relative to the -ac_staked percentage

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and hashrate could be a few CPU cores or a bunch of minis, and from genesis there is absolutely no way to know how much hashrate there will be, nor does it know how many coins there are, let alone how they are distributed

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: all of this combined means until height 2000 to 3000, likely blocks wont be 60 second apart and PoS percentage wont be at ac_staked

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: further, depending on actual hashrate vs. coins and its allocations, some ac_staked percentages at the extremes close to 1 and 99 wont be precisely achieved

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if you can improve its behavior, submit a pull request

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: @blackjok3r do you remember any other verus merge bugs than the null pubkey one?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i think just default values, so specifically calling setgenerate true N would overcome whatever defaults

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Not true, u must do set generate false first, I did figure out how to fix that, will have a look at code later and let u know
